Investigators are struggling to find eyewitnesses as the train passed through multiple stations, making passenger identification difficult.

Employees report long hours, slow promotions, and a feeling of being undervalued. This trend reflects a broader shift where younger generations prioritize work-life balance, meaningful work, and genuine growth over brand names alone.

‘They came from ponds': 40 crocodiles rescued from Haridwar homes and fields
description: Freshwater crocodiles, mostly juveniles, have been rescued from homes and farmlands in Haridwar and Laksar this monsoon, causing fear among residents. Officials believe these reptiles, now adults, originated from local ponds and reservoirs, entering residential areas in search of food.  Villagers are concerned for their children's safety and have requested that rescued crocodiles not be released back into the Ganga.

title: 'Sorry. Can't live with them anymore': Telangana woman kills self over fear of ants
description: A 25-year-old woman in Sangareddy district allegedly died by suicide due to a severe childhood fear of ants. She reportedly took the extreme step after noticing ants while cleaning her home. Her husband discovered her after returning from work, and a suicide note was found.

title: Deepfake scam: B'luru police probe AI videos of Kohli, Nirmala Sitharaman; case filed
description: Bengaluru cybercrime police have filed a suo motu case against unidentified individuals for creating and circulating AI-generated deepfake videos. These videos falsely depict prominent personalities like Virat Kohli and Nirmala Sitharaman endorsing fraudulent stock trading platforms and online games, aiming to lure unsuspecting victims into investment scams.

title: Mumbai terror trail: Flats once used for 1993 blasts meeting to be auctioned
description: Properties linked to 1993 Mumbai blasts accused Tiger Memon and his family, including a conspiracy meeting site, are slated for auction. Authorities have seized eight properties, with more in legal processes. Valuations are underway for these assets, with auctions anticipated in December or January, offering a glimpse into the aftermath of the devastating attacks.

title: Man ends life after video of him urinating in public goes viral
description: A 27-year-old man tragically ended his life after facing relentless online harassment and threats over a video. Despite apologizing, the sustained trolling led him to take the extreme step. Police have registered an FIR against seven individuals for abetment of suicide and circulating the damaging content.

title: Gujarat HC grants six month bail to Asaram on health grounds
description: Gujarat High Court granted six months' bail to Asaram, 82, on health grounds for medical treatment. He is serving a life sentence in a 2013 rape case. The court cited a similar directive from the Rajasthan High Court, which had also granted him bail for medical reasons.

title: Ford CEO questions Apple’s CarPlay: Warns of overreach; questions Tim Cook
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: 3 crocodiles drag Rajasthan man into Chambal river
description: A 37-year-old man from Rajasthan was tragically dragged into the Chambal River by three crocodiles in Madhya Pradesh. Despite a four-day intensive search by police and SDRF teams, no trace of Roop Singh Gurjar was found, and operations were officially called off. The incident occurred near a religious site, highlighting a lack of safety measures despite frequent crocodile sightings.

title: Sidney Crosby future: GM Kyle Dubas makes firm call on Penguins captain
description: Pittsburgh Penguins GM Kyle Dubas has definitively stated that captain Sidney Crosby's future remains with the team. Dubas emphasized his commitment to building a contending roster around Crosby, with no plans to trade the veteran.  He believes continued success and winning are the best solutions for the team's long-term vision.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife’s gift: MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
description: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.
